009package Ch13_Color_Images;
010
011
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
015import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
018import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.HsvColorSpace;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
021import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
022
023import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
024
025/**
026 * <p>
027 * ImageJ plugin, "rotates" the hue (H) of colors in HSV space by 120 degrees. Saturation (S) and value (V) remains
028 * unchanged. The rotation angle may be positive or negative. The input image is modified. Applying the plugin 3 times
029 * (with 120 degrees rotation) to the same image should reproduce the original image. See Sec. 13.2.3 of [1] for
030 * details.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
034 * (2022).
035 * </p>
036 *
037 * @author WB
038 * @version 2022/12/09
039 */
040public class Hsv_Rotate_Hue implements PlugInFilter {
041        
042        private static double RotationAngle = 120.0;    // shift hue by 1/3 of full circle (120 degrees)
043
044        /**
045         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
046         */
047        public Hsv_Rotate_Hue() {
048                if (noCurrentImage()) {
049                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Flower);
050                }
051        }
052
053        @Override
054        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
055                return DOES_RGB;
056        }
057
058        @Override
059        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
060                if (!runDialog()) {
061                        return;
062                }
063
064                ColorProcessor cp = (ColorProcessor) ip;
065                final double rot = RotationAngle / 360;                                                 // rot in [0,1]
066                final int[] RGB = new int[3];
067                HsvColorSpace cc = HsvColorSpace.getInstance();
068                
069                for (int v = 0; v < cp.getHeight(); v++) {
070                        for (int u = 0; u < cp.getWidth(); u++) {
071                                cp.getPixel(u, v, RGB);
072                                float[] HSV = cc.fromRGB(RgbUtils.normalize(RGB));              // all HSV components must be in [0,1]
073                                HSV[0] = (float) Arithmetic.mod(HSV[0] + rot, 1.0);             // rot may be pos. or negative
074                                int[] RGBnew = RgbUtils.denormalize(cc.toRGB(HSV));
075                                cp.putPixel(u, v, RGBnew);
076                        }
077                }
078        }
079
080        private boolean runDialog() {
081                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
082                gd.addNumericField("Hue rotation angle (degrees)", RotationAngle, 0);
083
084                gd.showDialog();
085                if(gd.wasCanceled())
086                        return false;
087
088                RotationAngle = gd.getNextNumber();
089                return true;
090        }
091}
